result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas A Bohlmann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
DNA Surcharge waived.
DNA Sample waived.

No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Attend a minimum of 2 self help meetings per week.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon successful completion of Probation, payment of all costs/fees, make efforts to finish with QAM and no new criminal law violations.  Defendant must Petition the Court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence.

Maintain full-time employment and/or school.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Nicholas A Bohlmann in court with attorney Nicole M Masnica.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 2,  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 1 dismissed and read in.

Court orders the following:
- 30 days Huber with standard release conditions. STAYED
- 1 year Probation. 
- Court costs of $243.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge waived
- DNA Sample waived
- Conditions of Probation:  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  Maintain full-time employment and/or school.  Attend a minimum of 2 self help meetings per week.
- Court grants expunction upon written request of the defendant and upon successful completion of Probation, payment of all costs/fees, make efforts to finish with QAM and no new criminal law violations.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 13, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Nicholas A Bohlmann in court with attorney Nicole M. Masnica.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court addresses defendant's WCS Report. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 13, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter received and filed.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter received and filed. Court will address at the next scheduled hearing.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter received and filed. Court reviewed letter and will take no action at this point as the Court was made aware of this at the last hearing.
Hearing on January 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.
